alert.note: Alert for Central Interior Cumberland; Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 27 at 11:00PM EST until March 01 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...LOW PRESSURE TO BRING ACCUMULATING SNOW TO THE REGION THROUGH TUESDAY... .An area of low pressure is expected to move from the Great Lakes TO New England overnight into Tuesday before pulling away from the region Tuesday night. Snow is expected to overspread the region from the late Monday evening into the nighttime hours and continue through the day on Tuesday before tapering off Tuesday night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 4 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 8 inches, with up to 10 inches possible in northern Carroll County New Hampshire. * WHERE...In Maine, Central Interior Cumberland and Interior York Counties. In New Hampshire, Strafford, Northern Carroll, and Southern Carroll Counties. * WHEN...From 4 AM Tuesday to 4 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create hazardous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions may impact the Tuesday morning commute and will impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Persons should delay all travel if possible. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution and be prepared for sudden changes in visibility. Leave plenty of room between you and the motorist ahead of you, and allow extra time to reach your destination. Avoid sudden braking or acceleration, and be especially cautious on hills or when making turns. Make sure your car is winterized and in good working order.
